data.question: What is the space group of the crystals [Ln2Cu3(IDA)6]nH2O?
Which software package was used for the molecular dynamics simulations?
What is the relation between the Ln atomic number and the n-value in [Ln2Cu3(IDA)6]nH2O?
data.answer: The n-value decreases with increasing atomic number of Ln.

data.question: True or False: The dielectric constant of the Sm crystal is 15 times larger than that of bulk water at 400 K.
What phenomenon is observed in the guest water molecules at approximately 170 K?
data.answer: Freezing of the positional freedom of guest water molecules

data.question: True or False: The lattice constants of the water-free La crystal showed significant anomalies at approximately 170 K.
What behavior do the guest water molecules exhibit at high temperatures?
True or False: The ε|| of [Ln2Cu3(IDA)6]nH2O increases rapidly with temperature above room temperature.
What is the effect of evacuating the sample cell on ε||?
True or False: The porous spaces of the Ho and Er crystals are larger than those of the La and Nd crystals.
What is the purpose of using a polyimide cell in the experiments?
data.answer: To store the sample crystal during dielectric measurements and suppress the decrease in ε at high temperatures

data.question: True or False: The positions of water molecules were kept fixed during the molecular dynamics simulations.
What is the average n-value for the crystals [Ln2Cu3(IDA)6]nH2O?
True or False: The dielectric constant ε of the Sm crystal at 400 K is less than 100.
What is the relationship between ΔTp and ΔT/Δt at approximately 170 K?
True or False: The guest water molecules in [Ln2Cu3(IDA)6]nH2O exhibit ferroelectric behavior at high temperatures.
What is the effect of increasing the atomic number of Ln on the magnitude of ε|| at 400 K?
data.answer: The magnitude of ε|| changes in the order La < Nd < Sm > Gd > Ho > Er

data.question: What does the presence of a shallow minimum at ∼240−280 K in the ε|| of [Ln2Cu3(IDA)6]nH2O indicate?
data.answer: It indicates a change in the dielectric behavior of the material.

data.question: True or False: The dielectric properties of guest water molecules in [Ln2Cu3(IDA)6]nH2O are consistent with molecular dynamics simulation results.
What is the significance of the dielectric constant becoming very small below ∼170 K?
data.answer: It signifies the freezing of thermal motion of water molecules.
